Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with stage II or stage III colorectal cancer (CRC) were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: Patients with stage II or stage III colorectal cancer (CRC)

Intervention.evidence: preoperative hepatic and regional arterial chemotherapy (PHRAC group, n = 110) or surgery alone (control group, n = 112)

Objective.evidence: To investigate whether preoperative hepatic and regional arterial chemotherapy is able to prevent liver metastasis and improve overall survival in patients receiving curative colorectal cancer resection.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was disease-free survival

Number_Randomised.evidence: PHRAC group, n = 110) or surgery alone (control group, n = 112)

Result_Outcome.evidence: the risk ratio of recurrence was 0.61 (95% CI, 0.51–0.79, P = 0.0002), of death was 0.51 (95% CI, 0.32–0.67; P = 0.009), and of liver metastasis was 0.73 (95% CI, 0.52–0.86; P = 0.02)

Harms.evidence: Toxicities, such as hepatic toxicity and leukocyte decreasing, were mild and could be cured with medicine.
